thread.title: Chronicle recommends: No on Prop. F
thread.title_full: Chronicle recommends: No on Prop. F - San Francisco Chronicle

title: Chronicle recommends: No on Prop. F
text:
Proposition F would close some of the gaping loopholes in San Francisco’s tepid attempt to regulate short-term rentals. Proposition F would close some of the gaping loopholes in San...
It’s tempting to support Proposition F, which would close some of the gaping loopholes in San Francisco’s tepid attempt to regulate short-term rentals. The ballot measure would hold platforms such as Airbnb and VRBO accountable for ensuring that hosts are registered with the city and adhering to a 75-day annual limit on short term rentals. It also would require tenants to get a landlord’s approval before advertising a short-term rental. It’s tempting to support Proposition F, which would close some of the gaping loopholes in San Francisco’s tepid attempt to regulate short-term rentals. The ballot measure would hold platforms such as Airbnb and VRBO accountable for ensuring that hosts are registered with the city and adhering to a 75-day annual limit on short term rentals. It also would require tenants to get a landlord’s approval before advertising a short-term rental.
